title: Tools-related courses - GIT, Markdown, Vim, Latex, JetBrains
description: A lot of tools that you might use such as GIT, Unity, VIM, Doxygen, and Docker. We are also including languages such as Markdown, Latex, and ReStructuredText.

courses.name: Docker
courses.title: Learn Docker containers
courses.desc: What's docker and how you could use it to run applications everywhere.

courses.name: Git
courses.title: Learn version-control with GIT
courses.desc: Git is the most famous version control tool, and as a programmer, you must learn it.

courses.name: JetBrains
courses.title: Learn JetBrains IDEs such as IntelliJ, PHPStorm, and CLion
courses.desc: Make your programming life easier by coding inside powerful preconfigured IDEs.

courses.name: VIM
courses.title: Learn how to use VIM editor
courses.desc: The legendary, old yet powerful console terminal editor.

courses.name: Markdown
courses.title: Learn Markdown, including the extended syntax
courses.desc: The most used language to write documentation or to write beautiful documents without needing a lot of knowledge or a complicated syntax.

courses.name: RST
courses.title: Learn ReStructuredText, and Sphinx
courses.desc: A language to write documentations outside your code with a lot of powerful tools such as generating UML, graphs ... The syntax is like an improved version of Markdown.

courses.name: LaTeX
courses.title: Learn how to write LaTeX
courses.desc: A language used to write reports, create presentations quite easily and with great style. You may also use it to write math in a website/documents.

courses.name: Doxygen
courses.title: Learn Doxygen to generate documentation
courses.desc: Write standardized documentation in your projects. You can generate a website, like with the Javadoc in Java.

courses.name: Inno Setup
courses.title: Generate modern installers with Inno Setup
courses.desc: A tool to create Windows installers, with an uninstaller and a modern interface.

courses.name: Unity 2D
courses.title: Notes and tips about Unity for 2D games
courses.desc: A gathering of notes about unity, focused on 2D knowledge.
